title: HTTP 1.1 Server
summary: Upgraded a C-based HTTP 1.0 server to fully support HTTP 1.1 with chunking, persistent connections, and caching.

description.situation: Web servers are black boxes until you build one yourself.
description.task: Build a multithreaded HTTP server capable of serving static files and parsing basic requests.
description.action: I wrote the server in C, handling sockets, threading, file I/O, and proper HTTP responses manually.
description.result: It served files efficiently, scaled to multiple connections, and gave me backend fundamentals from the ground up.

challenges: Refactoring old HTTP 1.0 code without breaking core routing logic.
Implementing chunked encoding and keep-alive logic efficiently.
Conducting thorough security and fuzz testing.
contributions: Implemented persistent connections and response chunking.
Added header-based caching and pipelining logic.
Ran packet analysis and fuzzing to verify security and correctness.
